Fourth, the capacities of those to whom the teaching is directed.
This has two parts:

Second, mutual harm means not only do the two principles contradict each other, they also mutually negate each other's substance.

Third, in terms of conformity, it means that this truth that exhausts conventionality must not obstruct the establishment of conventionality, because truth is not severed emptiness;
